    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(String[] args)
                 throws org.apache.commons.cli.ParseException,
                        IOException
        create a concept graph. This expects a property file in the classpath under CONCEPT_GRAPH_PATH/[name].xml

        If the properties file is found in a directory, the concept graph will be written there.

        Else (e.g. if the props file is coming from a jar), the concept graph will be written to the directory specified via the system property/ytex property 'org.apache.ctakes.ytex.conceptGraphDir'

        Else if the 'org.apache.ctakes.ytex.conceptGraphDir' property is not defined, the concept graph will be written to the conceptGraph subdirectory relative to ytex.properties (if ytex.properties is in a directory).

        Parameters:
        args -
        Throws:
        org.apache.commons.cli.ParseException
        IOException

      • createConceptGraph

        public void createConceptGraph(String dir,
                               String name,
                               String query,
                               boolean checkCycle,
                               Set<String> forbiddenConcepts)
                        throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: ConceptDao
        create the concept graph with specified name using specified query. Will create a file [name].gz under dir.
        Specified by:
        createConceptGraph in interface ConceptDao
        Parameters:
        dir - directory of concept graph (optional). If null will use directory specified by the system property/ytex property org.apache.ctakes.ytex.conceptGraphDir. If the property is not defined, use [directory of ytex.properties]/conceptGraph
        name - name of concept graph
        query - returns 2 string columns, 1st column is the child concept, 2nd column is the parent concept.
        checkCycle - if true will check for cycles and remove them (default true). If this is set to false, then only pagerank can be used on this graph.
        forbiddenConcepts - set of concepts whose edges will not be added to the concept graph (optional). By default, this includes umls concepts like C1274012 (Ambiguous concept).
        Throws:
        IOException

      • getConceptGraph

        public ConceptGraph getConceptGraph(String name)
        Description copied from interface: ConceptDao
        retrieve an existing concept graph. This attempts to find the concept graph as follows:
        • classpath: attempt to load org/apache/ctakes/ytex/conceptGraph/[name].gz
        • relative to org.apache.ctakes.ytex.conceptGraphDir: if that fails then relative to the directory defined by the system property/ytex property org.apache.ctakes.ytex.conceptGraphDir
        • relative to ytex.properties: if the org...conceptGraphDir property is not defined, then look for [directory of ytex.properties]/conceptGraph/[name].gz
        Specified by:
        getConceptGraph in interface ConceptDao
        Parameters:
        name - name of concept graph. Will retrieve from classpath/file system. @see #createConceptGraph
        Returns:

      • getDefaultConceptGraphDir

        public String getDefaultConceptGraphDir()
        use value of org.apache.ctakes.ytex.conceptGraphDir if defined. else try to determine ytex.properties location and use the conceptGraph directory there. else return null
        Returns:
